headline: President Trump delays release of some JFK files
subHeadline: Trump says he had no choice but to heed CIA, FBI warnings that some of the files on the assassination of President Kennedy be kept secret for further review; reaction and analysis on 'The Five.'

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I mean, you can't get away from the Russians, Greg. They keep coming us from every block in this show. GREG GUTFELD, "THE FIVE" CO-HOST: Do you know what I love about the Russians? They have a department in charge of sabotage and assassinations. They play the villain to a tee. They put the sign up there and say, yeah, just go to the department of assassination and sabotage.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: We had the cloaks over there and the daggers are in the locker. By the way, speaking of assassins, some of the best here are the plots to kill Castro. This is the United States now. Contaminated skin diving suit dusted with a deadly fungus inside. They were also going to booby-trapped what they called a spectacular seashell. So Castro enjoyed diving and they were going to put a shell that had bombs in it, but they couldn't find a large enough shell. I want this job to sit around and come up with fantastic ideas. It's incredible. The only this is that -- the problem with this, and I can see why some people are disappointing, it's like when you go to the carnival or a county fair and there's a sideshow they go like, this is a bearded lady and you're really excited as a 10-year-old, and it's a guy in a dress.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: And it pulls off.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yeah. And they would say to him -- they'll say it's a monster rabbit, but it's like a goat with rabbit ears. I feel like we got lead on a little bit. But my last point, Rachel Maddow just hammered Trump over this last night saying how they couldn't get it right. She's been carnival barking for nine months over Russian collusion with Trump, and there's more meat on a cricket than that story. She said she is going after President Trump for what she's doing every night from 9:00-10:00.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Not clarifying a 50-year-old conspiracy?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's like -- basically, that's exactly what happens every night. Jesse, you've done a lot of research on this today, and I wonder what your biggest take away was? JESSE WATTERS, "THE FIVE" CO-HOST: Well, we have a team of water's world research going over this page by page. So I'm really.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Investigating the department of sabotage?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: The final decision we've come too. It is funny off of Rachel Maddow how, you know, the left fantasizes about assassinating President Trump. And when he doesn't release things that might actually help other countries assassinate him through the CIA documents? Now she's mad. So I don't.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Wait a minute. She never said that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Isn't the left mad because Trump like withheld some of the stuff because the CIA doesn't want any of their research.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Richard is like this. RICHARD FOWLER, "THE FIVE" CO-HOST: I want to put like repellent up, no.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I accidentally followed everything.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Those are different documents exclusively obtain by "Watters' World."

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: We're going to be releasing those documents later on the "Watters' World" show.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, the other thing is President Trump was asked by the CIA, Richard, to hold some of these documents back. In six months, it will be revisited again. So we will be able to hold all this information and bring it back up.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: I actually -- I don't understand -- the secret service knew that he was going to do this and they should have gotten their act together to release all the documents at one time.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Meaning President Trump or Lee Harvey Oswald?

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: No, no, no. I mean.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That would be another.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: Jesse has confused the whole table now. But no, I'm saying the secret -- the intelligent agencies knew the president wanted to release these documents. He sent a memo over there.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, it was required by the law in 1992. On October 26, 2017, this will all be released unless there's a security concern, which there was, and President Trump he did it.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: Right. And I feel as though that the secret service had almost a decade to get their act together to figure out the security concern and deal with it. I applaud the president for releasing these documents because I think the American people deserve to know what happened to JFK. And I think now we can put all of these conspiracy theories too bed, the third bullet, the umbrella man, that LBJ did it. All of these conspiracies can now go to bed and we can move on and say he was assassinated, we now all know it was Lee Harvey Oswald. Now we know. Bravo, Mr. President.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: On the 2:00 show today, "The Daily Briefing," so Jim Woolsey the former CIA director was there. And basically what he said is that there is a theory about this guy who was and Romanian agent and he defected to the United States, highest level guy, and he said that Khrushchev had wanted JFK assassinated. So there was a plan going forward, but then he called it off. But Lee Harvey Oswald was such a die-hard believer that he went forward with it, and then they had Jack Ruby kill him to make sure that there was no -- that you couldn't find that connection. Do you buy that, Kimberly?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I have to tell you something's, for me -- some of these theories, I already heard before, you know, that they weren't very like revealing to me. And the Jack Ruby stuff I thought is kind of interesting. The other thing about going to get a confession in the hospital, I thought that was kind of interesting, but then really not able to do that, was like sort of a last-minute press to try to get that nugget to say, OK, we can wrap this up and close it down, and history would've been very different, I think, if they had been able to obtain that. One other thing, Dana, that I found was really interesting was the phone call, there was an intercept of a phone call connecting, like we talk about the Russians, I mean, they're everywhere, between Oswald and then also a death threat against him. Those things were pretty interesting that I thought where like new and kind of like revealing.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I thought that Woolsey was making a lot of sense. Greg, what do you think about this British newspaper getting a warning 25 minutes before the news broke.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Sometimes I just think that is -- you get a lot of chatter all the time and you get that terrorist attacks as well. So it may have just been a coincidence. I don't know who warned them. I don't know that part. But it is -- it's interesting. What you're getting is a look at what happens all the time -- things that you don't know what was going on. When I go back to the Castro stuff, we were doing this too. Like we were planning to off, you know, the head of a country because, you know, we didn't like him. And I look at this stuff and I go, this is really amazing. We must be doing this now or maybe we don't. But I wonder how many people have no idea what we're talking about because, you know, it's 50 some odd it -- what is it? How many years? Where we are now? Fifty three years ago? Fifty something?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes, 54.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yeah, 54. So many humans spent so much time and fictitious worlds. You know, playing video games that they -- history is not as interesting.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It does also show you how the intelligence community basically is looking through thousands of haystacks and.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: The chances of finding the needle are pretty slim.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well, I mean, I'm not sure -- there's a Russian thread here. The bomb.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Pull the thread.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Ready? If he's going to the embassy.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: Tell us that the emperor has no clothes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: In Mexico, the Russian embassy, and he's meeting with this assassination squad or something like, and he's making calls, and he's speaking Russian, broken Russian, they got him on a wiretap, how is it not a conspiracy? And then look at Hoover, the FBI director, making sure the public doesn't think it's a conspiracy because he would, so what? Make sure that there's not World War III? Because if everybody starts thinking the Russians were involved in the plot to assassinate the president of the United States, they're going to want to go to war.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, that might be why the national security community is still concerned about the release of all these documents. So.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: So true.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: The other thing that the Warren commission for which LBJ put on because people thought that he had done it, and they didn't have any of these documents when they started their investigation.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yeah. It said that there was tension between the FBI and the CIA. So some things never change. Straight ahead, what does he knows? The FBI informant clear to tell all on the Uranium One deal, allegedly has proof that Clinton engaged in quid pro quo with, guess who, the Russians. Details next.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Well, this week we've learn who paid for the infamous Russian dossier designed to harm President Trump's candidacy. The Clinton campaign and the Democratic National Committee. You think the chairman of the Clinton team and the head of the DNC at the time would remember funding a smear project like that. But all of a sudden, they caught a bad case of amnesia.

utterances.speaker: UNINDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: When did you learn the DNC and the Clinton campaign were behind the dossier?

utterances.speaker: UNINDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: I wasn't aware of the arrangement at all.

utterances.speaker: UNINDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: How could you -- could you have lead the DNC of being the dark about the dossier?

utterances.speaker: UNINDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: I wasn't aware of the arrangement at all.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: OK. So Dana, that sounds like somebody spent some time with a lawyer.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Probably. And the thing is -- they have been asked about this before. This story originally broke in January, meaning that there was the dossier and somewhere it was in the Democratic Party. They knew there had been some payments, but it wasn't directly connected to with to the DNC or to the Hillary Clinton campaign. It was some sort of third-party thing. Well, now we know that that actually was basically just money laundered through the law firm. And so, they could have found out if they wanted to. But I think that you're right that she's like -- it's better not to know.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It is pretty curious that nobody knows where $6 million is spent. I mean, they had that much money on the Hillary Clinton campaign and it didn't matter to them like where this money was going?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: And they wanted to run the country.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: The other thing is that Fusion GPS, one of the reasons they plead the Fifth, is that they don't want to turn over their banking records. So Kim Strassel, the Wall Street Journal has a column about this today, she's been following it very closely. And I have to take a look at that in particular because you have the bank record issue from Fusion GPS. You have this denial now from different entities who the New York Times is frustrated because they feel like they were lied to when they were asked about it before. And then in addition to all of that, you have campaign disclosure forms and anything over a certain amount, I think like $200, has to be listed. The reason you do it through a third party, like a law firm, which then denies it for several months is because you don't want have to disclose that you're doing something.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yeah. Well, OK, so Greg, the problem is this looks very bad for them because they said, oh, I don't know what you're talking about. I have no idea about that. I understand they don't want to have a statement that incriminate them or have any prior inconsistent statements. But it just seems like this was definitely they were trying to pull the wool over the eyes of the media and the American people.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It does look bad only if you're looking at it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Are you looking at it?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, the media, you know, here you have the possibility that the DNC colluded with Russia with the FBI's blessing. That's the other piece to this.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: That's smelling.  Hreg: Yes. The MSNBC crew that was still doing stories on how bots influenced the election, I think this might be a little bit more important. And I'm wondering will the networks, other than Fox News, start embracing the fact. Will CNN look at this and admit that this banana is a banana and Hillary has slipped on it. Or maybe it's an apple like the apple in the Garden of Eden, and the DNC took a big, bad bite of that evil apple, because that could be an apple or it could be a banana. I don't know. Anyway, Hillary deserves a nickname something about being crooked.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: OK. Well, I've got one for you, fruit of the loom.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I was referencing the CNN commercial about apples and bananas. Would you like me to go through it again?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: No, you did it yesterday.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: We have time, it's Friday.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: It worked out. All right. So Jesse, you know, you must be particularly enthralled, feel vindicated and unbelievably intelligent because this is what you've been saying all along.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: This is a great question. The answer is, yes, I do.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: You needed a confidence booster. My goodness.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Podesta and Debbie Wasserman, they're either incompetent or they're liars. I believe they're both. So Wasserman also had no idea her I.T. guy was crooked. She had no idea she was rigging the primary against Bernie until she got canned. Podesta, remember, he was the one that gave his password to the Nigerian king and it was password.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Password.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Right. So if you don't know, millions of dollars are being paid to some firm to dig up dirt on your opponent, then you're either oblivious and you're running a terrible campaign or you're not telling the truth. I believe both of these people aren't telling the truth. Also, some other nuggets in here.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Sure.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Fusion GPS, this firm they did business with also worked with the Russian lawyer Natalia. Now remember Natalia? She was the one that was sent over to Trump Tower to talk about Don Jr., very interesting coincidence. Also, the firm that the DNC hired to come in was hired by the same Clinton attorney, Elias or whatever his name is, to say, oh, yeah, you guys were hacked by the Russians over there at the DNC. And then, when the FBI say can we look at the server and investigate the firm said no, no, we've got this. No, it's fine. Take our word for it. And the FBI took the word for this firm.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: And why would they?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Why would they? So the whole thing smells and I'm just waiting for Richard to explain it away.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: Oh, no. I mean, I agree with Dana. I think we should take a look at Fusion GPS's bank records because you'll also find, Vanity Fair reported in September 2015 that Republicans hired Fusion GPS, and initially the same individual, Mr. Steele, who created the dossier. These never-Trumpers hired him to do work and to sort of unravel.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: No. Steele wasn't related to the Republican.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They hired him to look at Trump's casino.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: No, but they hired him to look at.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Not Steele.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Not Steele.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: They hire him to look -- you guys are correct. I was wrong. I spoke incorrectly.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Up next.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: I will admit -- I will admit my fault when I make them, right? So they hired Fusion GPS to look into Mr. Trump, right? And then they fired him right when they figured out that Trump was going to get the nomination.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: Democrats at this particular law firm hired Mr. Steele -- excuse me, hired Fusion GPS. Then, Mr. Steele was hired way after that, and he was also hired after the FBI had already opened up their probe into Russian.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Are you channeling Juan Williams?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I want to get to the gag order, friends.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: So the FBI probe was already open prior to this to dossier he's written.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: One point about Fusion GPS which I find interesting, did it used to be Wall Street Journal reporters?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yeah. I don't know about the second guy, but Glen Simpson was.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I think they realized that being reporters for a population that doesn't pay for their articles, isn't it interesting is targeting your talents, you know, to specific wealthy customer, they're essentially writing in-depth investigative reporting for people who will pay for it. If I want to do a piece on Jesse Watters, I hire Fusion GPS.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Right, I know. All right. As you know.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's just an analogy.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Don't get any ideas.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: All right. Tread water for a moment there. As you know, a gag order has been lifted on the former FBI informant on the Uranium One deal brokered by Russian when Clinton was secretary of state. He says he was intimidated by Obama administration lawyers not to talk and now he can. What does he know? We want to know. Here's what his lawyer told Fox News earlier.

utterances.speaker: UNINDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: He's got all the bribes. You know, those are recorded and sort of put into an indictment in 2014. We have on the record quid pro quo with the Clintons being paid, Bill Clinton being paid half a million dollars by Russians, people who were interested in the Uranium One deal going in bid. And we have the Clinton Foundation getting tens of millions of dollars from the same people involved in the deal. So you've got it right there, the quid pro quo. Now my client can put some meat on those bones and tell you what the Russians were saying during that time.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: All right. OK. So Dana, jump in the weeds with me.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I'm going to go in the way back machine.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: OK, go.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: So I know this guy, Dan McGordy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Good for you.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: He wrote an op-ed on October 12, 2010, and it was all about this deal. And he was questioning, why would we ever do this. And he was talking about the spinous process.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, here we go.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: The committee that's going to look. And he writes -- could start with a simple question. If a U.S. mining company, to saying nothing of the U.S. government back agency, made a bid for a majority control of a Russian uranium mine, what would Russia do? They would never allow it.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And so, I think questions about this go way back to -- why would we've done this in the first place and I'll have to get answers.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: And now the smoking gun is the unmasked, so to speak, informant who's been given freedom. Do you have something quick?

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: I will say quickly that there were nine people on this committee. Hillary was one of those nine people.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I agree.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: So to say that it's all Hillary Clinton it's absurd to me.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I didn't say that. No, I agree.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: No, people are making this argument I think is absurd. She was 1 of 9 votes. There were eight, seven other secretaries and two White House officials. Moving on.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Facebook Friday. Come on, everybody.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Greg is like mouthing it to me. No, wrapped, move on. It's Friday. The liberal media hard at work this week to provide cover for Clinton, when all else fails, what do they do? Blame Fox News. Next.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: Democrats like me aren't happy with the attempt to take on Hillary Clinton and turn attention away from President Trump's Russia investigation. But isn't really fair to blame Fox News for her dossiers and the Uranium One fiasco? These folks are.

utterances.speaker: UNINDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: This whole uranium thing comes from Fox News. I mean, this is a close investigation that came up in Peter Schweitzer's book, "Clinton Cash," in 2015. It was discredited then.

utterances.speaker: UNINDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: They tried to dredge up a series of debunk and overblown stories to muddy the water and make it look like it was actually Hillary who colluded with Russia. Fox News would much rather talk about Hillary than Donald Trump, that's because the right in the Trump era doesn't have coherent principles or an ideology, it just has enemies, which is why they prefer to have an alternate reality where Hillary Clinton is president.

utterances.speaker: UNINDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: It's a partisan effort align with what the White House has been urging and Fox and Breitbart, in which there's no consultation with the Democrats in congress. And I think that tells you all you need to know about whether this is in good faith or not.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: So Kimberly, what's your take?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yeah. I just think it's -- that's incredible, isn't it? How they can just go ahead and just like run a narrative all the way down the street to say that this is about Fox News. I mean, they so desperately want to whitewash this and they cover for Hillary Clinton that they'll literally do anything, say anything, to blame Fox. It's like -- there's no new bag of tricks here. It's like they do that. Despite the fact that what are we issuing, you know, a correction or anything like that, we get excellent sources, excellent news department to provide information. You know, we didn't create the Uranium One scandal, OK? So we're reporting on the news. We're covering it. That's what's happening here. It's called good journalism.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: Greg?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Kimberly is dead wrong. They're right. FNC is behind the uranium story. In fact, under the newsroom, Lou Dobbs has been running a sub level uranium mine which helps him pay for the rare lemur's saliva he injects into William Devane to keep him eternally young.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Oh, wow. What a freak.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: I don't know how you come up with this stuff.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: By the way, we -- what was the kid, Seth Young, whatever his name is, Seth Myers? So we don't -- "They're doing this so they don't have to talk about Trump." Are you kidding? That's all we do is talk about Trump! And we talk -- we say good stuff and bad stuff. The guy just doesn't watch. What happens with these shows is they have interns -- this is what happened on "The Daily Show." They have interns or assistants, and they sit there, and they just watch Fox. These guys don't watch Fox.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: And they pull clips.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And they pull little clips. And then they have them sit down, and they're sitting there eating a sandwich and they go, "Ooh, I like that. I like that." And they put together a package.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: They hide (ph) (INAUDIBLE)

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They have no idea what goes on on this network. They don't know anybody that watches this network.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: What they are doing is just repeating these weird fantasies in their head that are fueled by these little snippets that are fed to them like little birds.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Called Fox News JELL-O mold.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: They just put it all together.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Sorry about that.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: Where do you find Fox News JELL-O molds?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I've got some in the back in my car.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You have to be here a little while longer.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes, yes, yes.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: Clearly, they don't let me into, like, the secret Fox News door to buy the JELL-O mold. Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, you had made a good point before, and it's one that I've tried to make and others here have, as well.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You did?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It's that --

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: I always make good points, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- the CFIUS process requires signoff by nine different agencies. OK? But FOX News didn't originate this story. The Hill newspaper did.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: If that reporting turns out to be wrong, well, shame on us. I mean, that would be the case. But the one thing I would say in defense of FOX News is that, when any little nugget about any possible story line that connects to alleged Russian collusion on the Trump campaign happens, it is a full-bore breaking news everywhere else. So I think that everyone should just take a step back, let us find out a little bit more, meaning the committee should find a little bit more. And The Wall Street Journal has raised some really good questions about Mueller and Comey being at the FBI at the time. DOJ was a part of the CFIUS process. Did they know that any of this was going on, or was it totally blind? I think that is worth knowing.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: Mr. Watters.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS

utterances.speaker: WATTERS

utterances.speaker: WATTERS

This is based on The Hill reporting, which is based on actual documentation, actual files, and actual filings. This didn't originate here. We're just covering it. So to say that we're -- this whole story has been discredited, like Toobin said --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: It hasn't.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: -- how has it been discredited? And if it has been discredited, explain why, Toobin. Explain how it's discredited, and maybe you can debunk it instead of just saying, "Oh, Fox News is doing it." They're saying, you know, that all we want to do is talk about Hillary? Well, Hillary won't go away. We don't necessary -- well, we like talking about Hillary, but since she's hanging around, we're going to talk about her. What else do we have to talk about?

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: I mean, the president likes to talk about her, too.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Well, how about reporting and covering the news? Like, we're covering this, because it's important and significant and raises alarm and concern, and it should! They want to make jokes about it. So you know.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: I get it. Listen. My take on it is this. I just don't want another House or Senate investigation. There are too many of them, and they get us nowhere. So if people want to discuss this Uranium One thing, then let's get the best prosecutors, some of Kimberly's friends, to investigate it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You're saying it's time for a special prosecutor against Hillary Clinton on Uranium One?

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: No! Because you know what? I don't think they're going to find anything. They're going to say there were seven cabinet secretaries and two White House officials, and there was no "there" there. But let's not have another endless House or Senate investigation and get nowhere. Let's get some prosecutors. Let's look at it, and let's move on. And we're going to move on from walls to "Moana." There's a lot of costumes causing controversy this Halloween. Jesse hit the streets to find out what people are thinking about the most offensive ones. We'll talk about that ahead. We'll be right back.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Halloween is on Tuesday, as you know. The costume PC police are out in full force again this year. I asked some New Yorkers how they feel about the holiday hysteria.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Yes, Native American.

utterances.sentences: But I thought multiculturalism is a good thing.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE

utterances.speaker: WATTERS

utterances.speaker: WATTERS

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE

He says he was intimidated by Obama administration lawyers not to talk and now he can. What does he know? We want to know. Here's what his lawyer told Fox News earlier.

utterances.speaker: UNINDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: He's got all the bribes. You know, those are recorded and sort of put into an indictment in 2014. We have on the record quid pro quo with the Clintons being paid, Bill Clinton being paid half a million dollars by Russians, people who were interested in the Uranium One deal going in bid. And we have the Clinton Foundation getting tens of millions of dollars from the same people involved in the deal. So you've got it right there, the quid pro quo. Now my client can put some meat on those bones and tell you what the Russians were saying during that time.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: All right. OK. So Dana, jump in the weeds with me.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I'm going to go in the way back machine.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: OK, go.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: So I know this guy, Dan McGordy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Good for you.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: He wrote an op-ed on October 12, 2010, and it was all about this deal. And he was questioning, why would we ever do this. And he was talking about the spinous process.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, here we go.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: The committee that's going to look. And he writes -- could start with a simple question. If a U.S. mining company, to saying nothing of the U.S. government back agency, made a bid for a majority control of a Russian uranium mine, what would Russia do? They would never allow it.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And so, I think questions about this go way back to -- why would we've done this in the first place and I'll have to get answers.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: And now the smoking gun is the unmasked, so to speak, informant who's been given freedom. Do you have something quick?

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: I will say quickly that there were nine people on this committee. Hillary was one of those nine people.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I agree.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: So to say that it's all Hillary Clinton it's absurd to me.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I didn't say that. No, I agree.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: No, people are making this argument I think is absurd. She was 1 of 9 votes. There were eight, seven other secretaries and two White House officials. Moving on.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Facebook Friday. Come on, everybody.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Greg is like mouthing it to me. No, wrapped, move on. It's Friday. The liberal media hard at work this week to provide cover for Clinton, when all else fails, what do they do? Blame Fox News. Next.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Democrats like me aren't happy with the attempt to take on Hillary Clinton and turn attention away from President Trump's Russia investigation. But isn't really fair to blame Fox News for her dossiers and the Uranium One fiasco? These folks are.

utterances.speaker: UNINDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: This whole uranium thing comes from Fox News. I mean, this is a close investigation that came up in Peter Schweitzer's book, "Clinton Cash," in 2015. It was discredited then.

utterances.speaker: UNINDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: They tried to dredge up a series of debunk and overblown stories to muddy the water and make it look like it was actually Hillary who colluded with Russia. Fox News would much rather talk about Hillary than Donald Trump, that's because the right in the Trump era doesn't have coherent principles or an ideology, it just has enemies, which is why they prefer to have an alternate reality where Hillary Clinton is president.

utterances.speaker: UNINDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: It's a partisan effort align with what the White House has been urging and Fox and Breitbart, in which there's no consultation with the Democrats in congress. And I think that tells you all you need to know about whether this is in good faith or not.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: So Kimberly, what's your take?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yeah. I just think it's -- that's incredible, isn't it? How they can just go ahead and just like run a narrative all the way down the street to say that this is about Fox News. I mean, they so desperately want to whitewash this and they cover for Hillary Clinton that they'll literally do anything, say anything, to blame Fox. It's like -- there's no new bag of tricks here. It's like they do that. Despite the fact that what are we issuing, you know, a correction or anything like that, we get excellent sources, excellent news department to provide information. You know, we didn't create the Uranium One scandal, OK? So we're reporting on the news. We're covering it. That's what's happening here. It's called good journalism.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Greg?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Kimberly is dead wrong. They're right. FNC is behind the uranium story. In fact, under the newsroom, Lou Dobbs has been running a sub level uranium mine which helps him pay for the rare lemur's saliva he injects into William Devane to keep him eternally young.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Oh, wow. What a freak.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: I don't know how you come up with this stuff.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: By the way, we -- what was the kid, Seth Young, whatever his name is, Seth Myers? So we don't -- "They're doing this so they don't have to talk about Trump." Are you kidding? That's all we do is talk about Trump! And we talk -- we say good stuff and bad stuff. The guy just doesn't watch. What happens with these shows is they have interns -- this is what happened on "The Daily Show." They have interns or assistants, and they sit there, and they just watch Fox. These guys don't watch Fox.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: And they pull clips.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And they pull little clips. And then they have them sit down, and they're sitting there eating a sandwich and they go, "Ooh, I like that. I like that." And they put together a package.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: They hide (ph) (INAUDIBLE)

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They have no idea what goes on on this network. They don't know anybody that watches this network.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What they are doing is just repeating these weird fantasies in their head that are fueled by these little snippets that are fed to them like little birds.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Called Fox News JELL-O mold.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: They just put it all together.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Sorry about that.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Where do you find Fox News JELL-O molds?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I've got some in the back in my car.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You have to be here a little while longer.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes, yes, yes.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Clearly, they don't let me into, like, the secret Fox News door to buy the JELL-O mold. Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, you had made a good point before, and it's one that I've tried to make and others here have, as well.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You did?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It's that --

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: I always make good points, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: -- the CFIUS process requires signoff by nine different agencies. OK? But FOX News didn't originate this story. The Hill newspaper did.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: If that reporting turns out to be wrong, well, shame on us. I mean, that would be the case. But the one thing I would say in defense of FOX News is that, when any little nugget about any possible story line that connects to alleged Russian collusion on the Trump campaign happens, it is a full-bore breaking news everywhere else. So I think that everyone should just take a step back, let us find out a little bit more, meaning the committee should find a little bit more. And The Wall Street Journal has raised some really good questions about Mueller and Comey being at the FBI at the time. DOJ was a part of the CFIUS process. Did they know that any of this was going on, or was it totally blind? I think that is worth knowing.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Mr. Watters.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, you know when a scandal is real: when the left blames Fox News.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That's true.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: These are -- these are not just allegations. These are facts.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You said it directly. This is based not only on Peter Schweitzer's reporting, who's not a FOX News guy. This is based on The Hill reporting, which is based on actual documentation, actual files, and actual filings. This didn't originate here. We're just covering it. So to say that we're -- this whole story has been discredited, like Toobin said --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: It hasn't.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- how has it been discredited? And if it has been discredited, explain why, Toobin. Explain how it's discredited, and maybe you can debunk it instead of just saying, "Oh, Fox News is doing it." They're saying, you know, that all we want to do is talk about Hillary? Well, Hillary won't go away. We don't necessary -- well, we like talking about Hillary, but since she's hanging around, we're going to talk about her. What else do we have to talk about?

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: I mean, the president likes to talk about her, too.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Well, how about reporting and covering the news? Like, we're covering this, because it's important and significant and raises alarm and concern, and it should! They want to make jokes about it. So you know.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: I get it. Listen. My take on it is this. I just don't want another House or Senate investigation. There are too many of them, and they get us nowhere. So if people want to discuss this Uranium One thing, then let's get the best prosecutors, some of Kimberly's friends, to investigate it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You're saying it's time for a special prosecutor against Hillary Clinton on Uranium One?

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: No! Because you know what? I don't think they're going to find anything. They're going to say there were seven cabinet secretaries and two White House officials, and there was no "there" there. But let's not have another endless House or Senate investigation and get nowhere. Let's get some prosecutors. Let's look at it, and let's move on. And we're going to move on from walls to "Moana." There's a lot of costumes causing controversy this Halloween. Jesse hit the streets to find out what people are thinking about the most offensive ones. We'll talk about that ahead. We'll be right back.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Halloween is on Tuesday, as you know. The costume PC police are out in full force again this year. I asked some New Yorkers how they feel about the holiday hysteria.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What costumes do you find offensive on Halloween?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: For example, like, an Indian, like, or something?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Native American.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Yes, Native American.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: But I thought multiculturalism is a good thing.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: It is, but there's, like, complex structures to it that, like, add layers and make it more complicated than that.

utterances.speaker: JIM CARREY, COMEDIAN
utterances.utterance: What the hell are you talking about?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Do you know what she's talking about, Gutfeld?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I think she means well. You know, but the thing is this whole kind of, like, "This costume is evil; this costume is good." It's a way to express moral superiority among your peer group. You have to be the first person --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Virtue signaling.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I got that word from you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But it's like if you can be the first in line to condemn a costume, it's kind of like being the earliest member at church. It's like, you're the first -- you're in the front pew. That's what it --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Because identity politics is a religion. You have penances. You have indulgences. You have confessions.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And it has weird rules.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There's a lot of weird -- yes.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And everything it targets, whether it's football, or whether it's Halloween, or holidays, identity politics infects and then divides.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And there are a lot of rules, as you say. And explain to me, Richard. As a white male in America, why can't I --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Oh. Thank God. Thank God you cleared that up.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- dress up as someone from another culture on Halloween?

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: It's just -- it's the wrong thing to do.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Tell me why.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Because you offend people.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: How?

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Jesse, we have -- this segment is three minutes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I just want to know!

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: After the show is over, I will -- we can have a nice -- we can have a glass of whiskey, and I will tell you why it's -- why it's the wrong thing to do.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Whiskey? What kind of whiskey?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I'm Irish.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Or bourbon.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK, as long as --

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: I will give you -- I will just give you a list of costumes you shouldn't wear. How's that?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Go for it.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: No black face.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Obviously, Richard.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Good. Glad we're there, right?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What do you think this is?

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: No indigenous people outfits. No mimicking of indigenous people.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So you can't dress up as a Native American?

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Correct. No indigenous people. That would be the same thing.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Could a Native American dress up as me?

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Wow.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I'd like to see that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No?

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: I think that would --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It would be a boring costume.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So is that be culturally appropriating me?

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: I actually think -- I actually think that would be offensive.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You think I would be offended if a Native American dressed up as Jesse Watters on Fox News for Halloween?

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: I think you would actually --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You're taking offense for me.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: I think, because you're sort of sick and twisted like that, you would get off on it. I think you would be offended.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Just so you know --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What are you being for Halloween?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Just so you know, there's not a lot of demand for that costume.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There has to be a Jesse Watters costume.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's flying off the shelf! Collar up and a microphone.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: What am I dressing up as? Well, Jessica Rabbit.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Rabbits are offended.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Is that bad?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Richard, what do you think?

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: I'm not, like, -- why am I --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: PETA might not like it.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Are rabbits offended?

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Am I sort of, like, the PC police here? I'm just saying --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, Richard.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I think the best costumes are the ones that, as I always understood, the ones that make you go, "Oh, my gosh, I can't believe they actually did that."

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Like what?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: They're supposed to be a little shocking. Well, it's whatever it is that's offending people. That's kind of the point.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, like Colin Kaepernick.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Are you going to be something in the parade?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Gutfeld -- if Gutfeld was Colin Kaepernick, threw an afro on, put the jersey on --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Do not pull me -- do not pull me into your weird little world. No, no, no. I'm going as Tucker Carlson. So what I do is, I ring the doorbell, I ring the doorbell, and I go, "Um" -- then they take a wide shot.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: OK, now you're on. You're on.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Then I just go --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Now you're on.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Then I just stare at them like this. For about a minute. And then I go, "Thanks for coming on the show. Thanks for coming on the show."

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You got it.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes, do the astonishment face.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Next, "Facebook Friday."

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Thank goodness.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Don't go away.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, "Facebook Friday." Is that your phone?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No, that was Richard's.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Fake news!

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: This is fake news, America.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Halloween edition, you silly people. This is from Marie H. I'll go to you, Kimberly. "What is -- for October, what's your favorite horror movie and why?"

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: It says "or show" and you didn't read the rest of it -- fine, it's no problem. So here's --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: -- the issue for you. I absolutely cannot watch any horror films, scary movie. I am traumatized from a slumber party in seventh grade --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Me, too.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: -- where I had to see, like --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: "Carrie" was the one.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes. "Carrie." Freddie Krueger --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That was a comedy.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: -- "Friday the 13th," all of that. Terrifying.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Stephen king's best adaptation was "Carrie," I thought. Amazing.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I saw "It?" Did you see that?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, I haven't seen it. Good?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's pretty good.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: But mine is "Nightmare on Elm Street." Definitely. I was that for Halloween for a number of years.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: How offensive.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Richard.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: "Saw."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's gruesome.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: My problem is, I can't watch horror movies in movie theaters, because I'm the person that talks. I'm like, "You're stupid! Run, girl, run!"

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You can't go to my movie theater.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Dana, what do you --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I'm with her. I've --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: "You're with Her"? That's a terrible movie.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That movie bombed.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: She means she's like, is with K. to the G.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes. My parents wouldn't let me watch scary movies, and so now I'm terrified.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Me? Obviously, "Love, Actually." Probably the scariest movie -- the scariest movie ever put to film. You know, you can't -- a lot of people, they just throw up. I was in a theater once, and people were just vomiting while watching "Love, Actually."

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: No, they're not.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They actually banned it in 14 countries!

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: You're lying.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Next question: "What is your least favorite thing you ever received when you went trick-or-treating?" Like, her example is her son once got pencils.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Raisins.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Raisins?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: A box of raisins.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, a box of raisins. That's a --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Your parents have those in the pantry. Don't give them in the -- treat box.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Fruit or vegetables, or pennies.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Pennies! Yes, the taste of copper.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Bad candy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Bad candy. A good name for a band. Richard.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Almond Joys.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. I hate coconuts!

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Send them my way.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, that's Mounds.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Sometimes you feel like a nut.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's Mounds.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: No, but I think they --

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Gave me Snickers bars, man. Snickers bars --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Reese's.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Three Musketeers. Give me the good stuff. Don't give me Almond Joys. Come on.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Kimberly.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Spring for the good candy.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Well, you know what? I don't want to -- I particularly don't want to get, like, a granola bar.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I mean, mot that I dislike those. I just don't want it in that moment.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: If you have it in your pantry, don't -- that shouldn't be what you give out for Halloween.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Like, don't give me kale chips. Right, Dana?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That could be me.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: My least favorite thing I got on Halloween was razor blades. I was like, "I don't even shave."

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Remember when that was going on?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: By the way, the dumbest rumor of all time --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I know, but it's so bad.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: -- in razor blades in apples, because who would do that? Because the kids would just -- if the kids got that, they would just tell the police where they got it from. They don't have one documented incident.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: That is a homophobic rumor, and it's sad. It's really sad.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Let's not -- let's not go there.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Homophobic?

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Yes, because that is what they say. They say that, like, gay men give out apples.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I didn't know that.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: That is literally -- that is a homophobic thing!

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I never heard that. I've learned something new here on "The Five."

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That's why you always have to DVR, watch "The Five."

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Way to bring it up, Greg!

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We've had this question before.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Go ahead.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: This is from Milka C. She goes, "If you were president for one day, what executive order which you sign?" Richard.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: I'd free all my sons. It's a Lauryn Hill song.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't know. Sing it.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: You never heard the Lauryn Hill song?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: No, I know, but that's an executive order?

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: (SINGING) If I ruled the world, I'd free all of my sons.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: That would be your theme music.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: K.G., what would you --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I don't know. Trump is, like, doing such a good job of killing ISIS, he's putting me out of business. Because that would be my one executive order. Like, destroy.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Maybe bring back waterboarding. You know, just for -- just for fun.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: By the way, I agree. I mean --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes. Bring it back.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: It actually works.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: For any special occasion? Or for a specific --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, to fight the war on terror.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I just want to be clear.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK. Thank you for clearing that up.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I would do something on adoption to make --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, good.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: -- make it easier for people that want to adopt to be able to adopt children. More --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: That is a very good one.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It's actually something that they can and should do.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You're absolutely right.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: You should talk to Ivanka Trump about that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I would ban Radiohead in public places. Everybody knows they're a poor man's Air Supply. And I just think it's time to move on.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Wow. You moved off the Red Hot Chili Peppers.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What? Oh, I hate the Red Hot Chili Peppers.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh, my God.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They're a poor man's Smashmouth. Rashan G. asks -- ooh, I skipped -- I'm sorry. Sorry, Rashan. We're not getting to you.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Wow.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Kathy says if you had to pick a song to describe you, what would it be? Jesse?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: "Rocket Man." Definitely "Rocket Man." We're going all the way up.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right. Kimberly's face is utter disgust.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They took that shot, but they didn't.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Thank God. What song? I mean, come. We -- haven't we done this one, too?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't know.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I can't say it now. Probably can't say it now.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Like -- go ahead.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: No. Go to Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I can't think of the song! It's about a dog. It's a country music song.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: "Shannon?" Remember "Shannon," about --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: What about your girl crush song you told me you like, you sent?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That's a good song.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What other dog songs are there? "Shannon," that was the dog that went away. Didn't come back.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Billy Currington has a song about a dog, I believe.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: All right, I've got my answer. My favorite running song, "Simply the Best" by Tina Turner.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's good, that's good.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But what was Rashan's question?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: My song: "Afternoon Delight," because that's what "The Five" is. An afternoon delight.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Wow, that was really --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Starland Vocal Band. No?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You people are young.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Or I'm old.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: The poor man's Beatles.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They poor man's Beatles.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: They're wrap -- they're wrapping you, you did such a good job.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: "One More Thing" is up next.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: What next?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It's time now for "One More Thing." OK. Workers at the Utqiagvik Airport in Alaska --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Gesundheit.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: -- we're in for a big surprise on Monday. Check this out. This would irritate you, Greg. A 450-pound bearded seal was plopped down in the middle of the runway so nobody could leave. And they waited for the seal to move. They basically -- well, the pilot said, "We have a low sealing." They tried to make people realize, like, that they've got to wait for a minute. Scott Babcock capture the moment on camera and said, "It was very strange to see the seal. I've seen a lot of things on the runway, but never a seal." But you never know what you're going to get in Alaska.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: K.G.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: All right. Fantastic. So today, I had the privilege of being at the Synergy Global Forum, where I'm MC and hostess with the mostest, and conducting the Q&A. That's me walking out. Jesse, you'd be jealous. I had some smoke. It is a fantastic event.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Nice entrance.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: The biggest -- one of the biggest business events in the world. Brings together huge names in business and disruptors.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: -- disrupted.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: That's Guy Kawasaki. Sir Richard Branson, Steve Forbes, Ray Kurzweil, Jack Welch. And tomorrow, Robin Wright. So it's a two-day conference today and tomorrow in New York City. And it was like, wow.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Smart people.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Mind-opening, right. Revolutionary.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Cool.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right. So "Watters' World" this weekend, we have a very big lineup. We have Eric Trump, Kellyanne Conway, and Dean Cain. And as you also know, we did an offensive Halloween costume edition, and we're debuting a new feature. It's called "Texts That Haven't Aged Well" - excuse me, "Tweets That Haven't Aged Well." We're going to run those for you at the top of the show. You'll love it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Pretty funny.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. You don't want it to be texts.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It could be from your mom. All right. Greg.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Another thing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: The "G.G. Show," which is 10 p.m. on Saturday. We've got Kevin Sorbo. I hear he's got a movie out. There's Tom Shillue on the left there. And there's Kat Timpf, having a birthday this weekend. And Tyrus! So it's going to be a fun show. Now, Donald Trump had some kids over trick-or-treating at the White House. They were the offspring of the media. And I love this, because even with the children of the -- Donald Trump couldn't help but rip the media, their parents, to the children's faces. It's enjoyable.

utterances.speaker: DONALD TRUMP, R-PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES
utterances.utterance: I cannot believe the media produced such beautiful children. You're going to grow up to be like your parents? Don't answer. That can only get me in trouble, that question. So how does the press treat you? I bet you get treated better by the press than anybody in the world, right? You did a good job. You did a good job. Here, you did a good job.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: By the way, if you notice, there was my favorite costume of all time in the back there. A unicorn.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Look! How cute. Don't you think that's so funny?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I think that's a fun little event.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's -- it's white. President Trump is the most entertaining politician I think we've ever had.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That is hilarious.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Real.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes. Today, when we talked about one of the things that one of the guys had said, was that Donald Trump was one of the biggest, like, disruptors that we've seen in the past; and that kind of volatility brings about change, it can be good.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'm a disruptor.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Every day, which is why it works here.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's why I go to the doctor.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Amen, the producers say in the ear. All right. Richard.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Well, this past week was my mother's birthday.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Happy birthday!

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: So happy birthday to my mom.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: There she is.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: There is Mama Dukes, Pauline. It was her birthday. And so I thought that I would give some -- and my mom is a single mother, so I thought I would give advice to single mothers. So Fowler's advice for single mothers, especially those raising boys. This is going to be a tough one. It took me a long time to write this. So first, I want to tell you that it is OK. You are doing way, way, way better than you think you are. And I want to say to you that they're listening. We are listening. It might not seem like it, because we're distracted with the cell phones, the Xbox, the PlayStation, the TV, but we hear you. And we are listening. So single mother, moms out there? We are listening, and you're doing way better than you think you are.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Toughest job in America.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: And I tried to do this without looking at Kimberly.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Thank you, Richard.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: If I'd looked at K.G., I think I might've cried.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Aww.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Aww. (GIVES RICHARD A HUG)

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: She makes me cry every day.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Hey, I remember the name of the song.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: That's earned (ph).

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What's the name of the song?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: The song that I -- from "Facebook Friday." It's "Like my Dog" by Billy Currington.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, there you go.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: About how the dog doesn't ask him where he's been or, like, to do the dishes or anything. The dog just loves him because he's who he is.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, but a dog doesn't expect anything of you, so you could end up being just a horrible person. Dogs have very low expectations.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You cannot be a horrible person around a dog. I mean, unless you're abusing the dog. And that's a real -- obviously, very inappropriate.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I wasn't going there, Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: What were you going?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I was just talking about how terrible a person you are around Jasper.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I am a pretty bad person.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Awful person, because Jasper just lets you do whatever you want.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: We'll continue that discussion next week. Set your DVRs. Never miss an episode of "The Five." "Special Report" is up next.
